org.settings4j.settings.nop
Class NOPSettings

java.lang.Object
  org.settings4j.settings.nop.NOPSettings
All Implemented Interfaces:
SettingsInstance
public class NOPSettings
extends java.lang.Object
implements SettingsInstance

No-operation implementation of Settings used by NOPSettingsRepository.

NOPSettings

public NOPSettings(SettingsRepository settingsRepository)
Method Detail

addConnector

public void addConnector(Connector connector)
Description copied from interface: SettingsInstance
Add a Connector.
This method will be call, if you create a connector-ref to a connector configuration in your settings4j.xml 
 Example configuration in settings4j.xml:
 --------------------------------------
 <settings name="com.mycompany" >
     <connector-ref name="DBConnector" />
 </settings>
 --------------------------------------

Specified by:
addConnector in interface SettingsInstance

removeAllConnectors

public void removeAllConnectors()
Description copied from interface: SettingsInstance
Remove all Settings. (Internal use only)

Specified by:
removeAllConnectors in interface SettingsInstance

getContent

public byte[] getContent(java.lang.String key)
Description copied from interface: SettingsInstance
return the found byte[]-Value for the given key.
The SettingsInstance Instance iterates all his Connector and return the first found Value.

Returns null if no connector found a Value for the given key

Specified by:
getContent in interface SettingsInstance
Parameters:
key - the Key for the configuration-property. e.g.: "com/mycompany/myapp/myParameterKey"
Returns:
the found byte[]-Value for the given key

setContent

public void setContent(java.lang.String key,
                       byte[] value,
                       java.lang.String connectorName)
Description copied from interface: SettingsInstance
Set ( or overwrite ) the Value for the Given key.
The SettingsInstance Instance iterates all his Connector and if a Connector can successful write the new Value, then the Connector must return Constants.SETTING_SUCCESS
If No Connector can write the Value ( all Connector returns Constants.SETTING_NOT_POSSIBLE then a NoWriteableConnectorFoundException will be thrown.

Specified by:
setContent in interface SettingsInstance
Parameters:
key - the Key for the configuration-property. e.g.: "com/mycompany/myapp/myParameterKey"
value - the new byte[]-Value for the given key
connectorName - The name of the connector, who should be used to set the value

setObject

                      java.lang.Object value,
                      java.lang.String connectorName)
Description copied from interface: SettingsInstance
Set ( or overwrite ) the Value for the Given key.
The SettingsInstance Instance iterates all his Connector and if a Connector can successful write the new Value, then the Connector must return Constants.SETTING_SUCCESS
If No Connector can write the Value ( all Connector returns Constants.SETTING_NOT_POSSIBLE then a NoWriteableConnectorFoundException will be thrown.

Specified by:

getMapping

public java.util.Map getMapping()
Description copied from interface: SettingsInstance
The key mapping defined in settings4j.xml: 
 Example:
 <mapping name="defaultMapping">
     <entry key="com/mycompany/moduleX/datasource" ref-key="global/datasource"/>
     <entry key="com/mycompany/moduleY/datasource" ref-key="global/datasource"/>
 </mapping>
Settings.getXXX("com/mycompany/moduleX/datasource");
should return the configured value under "global/datasource"

Specified by:
getMapping in interface SettingsInstance
Returns:
the Mappings of this Settings-Object (without inheritances)

setMapping

public void setMapping(java.util.Map mapping)
Description copied from interface: SettingsInstance
Set the mapping for this Settings-Object without inheritance.
This method will be call, if you create a mapping-ref to a mapping configuration in your settings4j.xml 
 Example:
 <root mapping-ref="defaultMapping" >
    ...
 </root>
 
 <mapping name="defaultMapping">
     <entry key="com/mycompany/moduleX/datasource" ref-key="global/datasource"/>
     <entry key="com/mycompany/moduleY/datasource" ref-key="global/datasource"/>
 </mapping>

Specified by:
setMapping in interface SettingsInstance
